results.title: 75th anniversary outing
results.description: Older members will be able to go on the Guild's 75th anniversary day trip thanks to a lottery grant.  They will visit Higham Park, near Canterbury and look around the historic house and gardens followed by a cream tea. coach hire and cost of fifty cream teas

recipientOrganization.name: Ramsgate Albion Evening Towns Women's Guild

results.title: Pilot Festival
results.description: Denmead will run a week long summer mini community festival at which residents will be able to take part in a range of cultural and sporting activities, including jazz and brass band concerts, skateboard competition, art show, forest forge show and workshops.

results.title: Music education work in special schools
results.description: Local children from special schools will have the opportunity to work with professional musicians who will be performing at the festival. The musicians will run workshops and perform with the children at each school.

results.title: Purchase of digital camera & printer
results.description: This branch will purchase its first digital camera and printer to record its 70th birthday celebrations.  The majority of members are over 70 years old and several will increase their skills by editing the photos on P.C.s.  The record of events will then be put into a book which will form the latest edition in a series of scrap books scanning many years and occasions.

results.title: Gala Day
results.description: This community group support the residents in the area and will use an award to hold a gala day which will also be offering advice, information and opportunities in the area. birds of prey display, insurance, marquee, flooring, advertising and local jazz band

results.title: Studio Update
results.description: This group provide a ward visiting service to collect requests for patients.  They will use the award to update and refurbish their studio. computerised playout system and software

results.title: toys and cupboard
results.description: This church would like to improve the facilities in its community building. The award will provide toys and lockable storage cabinets for use by the groups that use the hall. toys and lockable storage cabinets.

results.title: Illustrated talks for schools
results.description: The group will buy presentation equipment.  This will enable them to hold a series of illustrated educational talks and presentations for schools, local community and youth groups.  Local people will be provided with a greater awareness of local wildlife and nature conservation.

results.title: 2004 Summer Open Fun Days
results.description: Girls aged 8-16 will attend a series of open football sessions. They will learn new skills and there will be opportunities to join the club and continue training for anyone who is interested. The training will be undertaken by members of the U18 team who have achieved coaching qualifications.

results.title: Lewes University of the Third Age
results.description: This branch of the U3A will improve the delivery of its lectures and educational sessions through the provision of computer presentation equipment.

recipientOrganization.name: Lewes U 3 A (University Of The Third Age)

results.title: Bingo machine
results.description: An automatic bingo machine and raffle MultiMate will increase the number of members able to take part in the monthly games. The machine will enable the hard of hearing and visually impaired to take part in the games as well as organising the sessions. A croquet set will provide the more active members of the club with an additional activity.

results.title: Epilepsy Information Day
results.description: This branch of the Epilepsy Association will stage an information day. It will feature speakers and will be an opportunity for those affected by the condition to learn more about it and the most recent treatments.

results.title: Container
results.description: This group promote the tradition of pigeon racing. The award means they can purchase a larger cabin to allow them to accept more members. storage container.

results.title: Music project
results.description: The school will work with a local home for old people to establish a cross-generational music project.  Young and old will work together under the guidance of trained staff and volunteers.  The people involved will learn new music skills and how to play instruments together.

results.title: Youth Drama
results.description: Disaffected young people aged 16-20 will have the chance to take part in a theatre project at this school. Participants will attend a series of workshops before performing a piece of work derived from the workshop sessions.

results.title: Production of a parish book
results.description: Local people will be asked to participate in a project exploring the history of the village through personal memories and celebrating what it is now.  A book will be produced and artwork created for the village hall.

results.title: Football
results.description: This group promotes the sport of football in its area. The award means they can set up a girls under 9's team, two under 7's teams and purchase new kit for 2 of their existing teams.  They will also be able to send new managers for these teams on training courses and stock up their club library with new books.. strips and equipment for various teams, coaching courses, child protection courses, police checks, coaching books/videos.

results.title: Summer Outings
results.description: This group provide social activities for local residents.  They will use this award to pay for two summer outings. day trip to Alnwick Castle and Gardens and to the Lake District.

results.title: New Teams
results.description: The club will develop its junior squads and establish a new age group.  U12 and U16 teams will be formalised and entered in a league for the forthcoming season, provided with kit and training to enable this to happen.  A new U10 squad will be established to compete in a local High 5 league.  Local girls will be able to take part in healthy activity and develop their skills at the club.

results.title: Rock challenge
results.description: 100 pupils will be entered for the "Rock Challenge". This is a national dance competition between schools which promotes fitness while discouraging children from taking drugs or smoking.

results.title: Speakers and Trips
results.description: This club offers social and educational activities for older people in Wellow. This project is to broaden the range of activities available through the provision of extra speakers and trips.

results.title: Music festival
results.description: A five day festival of music performances in Tilford and Farnham will offer local people a chance to hear live performances of classical music. A children's workshop will offer children from Waverley Abbey School the opportunity to work with musicians from the Royal Academy of Music. An open workshop will offer anyone from the local community to take part in a choral workshop directed by a leading baroque musician.

results.title: Start up astronomy club
results.description: An observation club will be set up where children and young people can use a telescope to make observations of the sun, moon, planets and stars. They will learn how to record their observations and use them to make predictions of the planets positions and moon phases.

recipientOrganization.name: The Grove School and Specialist Science College

results.title: Refurbishment of Bowling Green
results.description: This group promote the sport of bowling in their area. The award means they can erect a security fence around their bowling green. security fence

results.title: Summer Camp
results.description: Children and young people who would not otherwise have a holiday will be invited to attend a summer camp where they will try a range of outdoor activities.

results.title: Primary schools athletics development
results.description: Pupils from many primary schools in the Farnborough and Aldershot area will have the opportunity to participate in athletics as a result of this project.  Fernhill school will lead on this partnership initiative which is aimed at letting youngsters experience new concepts in athletics.  The equipment will be used on a rota basis by each school as it can be broken down into athletic disciplines.

recipientOrganization.name: North East Hampshire School Sport Partnership

results.title: Philip Southcote School
results.description: This school will establish a youth club for past and present pupils with learning difficulties. Members will be able to take part in a range of activities including arts workshops, sports and educational workshops.

results.title: Equipment for start up
results.description: Young people from Reading will have the opportunity to join a new boxing club in Southcote and be trained to increase their levels of exercise and fitness. A volunteer will also be trained to receive ABA coach accreditation.

results.title: Racing Equipment
results.description: This homing society will use an award to purchase pigeon racing equipment, they hope to attract new younger members with the new equipment. pigeon timing clocks, data printer, race manager software

results.title: Graveyard
results.description: Young people from this theatre group will have the opportunity to take part in a film making project. Participants will be involved at all stages of the process and develop new skills and techniques.

recipientOrganization.name: The Complete Works Theatre Company Ltd

results.title: I T Equipment
results.description: This local history group will use funding to purchase IT equipment which will allow them to produce a computerised data base. lap top computer, digital camera, digital projectors, overhead projector, computer software, laminator, insurance and security

results.title: Refurbishment
results.description: This group provides adult education, recreational activities, youth work and practical services to voluntary groups.  They will use the award to buy furniture and refurbish their community centre. furniture, lighting and decorating

recipientOrganization.name: Area Training and Activity Centre (ATAC) Limited

results.title: Meetings and outings
results.description: The Association will take its members on social trips of military and educational interest.  Older people will be able to go on trips to reduce isolation.

recipientOrganization.name: Market Garden Veterans Association - No.12 Sussex Branch

results.title: After School Trampoline Club
results.description: Pupils from this school will have extended access to trampolining through the provision of new equipment. Training is available from qualified coaches, and pupils will have the chance to take part in local competitions.

results.title: Training and development programme
results.description: People from all backgrounds will have the opportunity to develop skills in skiing through a structured training programme to encourage wider participation in the sport. Volunteers will also be coached to increase the club's pool of qualified trainers.

results.title: Feasibility Study
results.description: This group aims to provide the opportunity for disabled people to ride and/or carriage drive in order to benefit their health and well being. The group will use the award to consult with current and potential users and create a business development plan. current and potential user analysis, competitor analysis, evaluation and report writing.

recipientOrganization.name: Tyne and Wear Riding for the Disabled Association

results.title: Nature Program
results.description: Children from this pre-school will learn about nature in an urban environment through a series of workshops. They will also attend arts sessions where they will base songs and drama on what they have learnt during the project.

results.title: Launch day
results.description: Older people will be encouraged to undertake more physical activity and find fun in different forms of activity at a day that will include information, taster sessions and opportunities for group discussion. HVA will also provide follow up sessions to the day to help participants develop new habits of physical activity.

results.title: Boxing Equipment
results.description: This group was set up in 1952 to promote amateur boxing throughout East Durham.The award will be used to upgrade their boxing ring  and buy other equipment. boxing ring (including delivery and set up); boxing strip; bunch boy and ladies boxing mitts.

results.title: Chess Club
results.description: Children from the age of 6 will have the chance to learn how to play chess with the help of coaches. The club will run taster sessions in local schools and organise local competitions.

results.title: Setting up of after school clubs.
results.description: Taster sessions in badminton will be offered to primary school age children to encourage them to play the sport. Teachers will be given training so that an after school club can be set up. Students from a linked secondary school will be given the chance to obtain a Leaders Award so that they can run the after school clubs successfully.

results.title: Art and Craft Activities
results.description: Blind and partially sighted people will have the opportunity to try a range of arts and craft activities specifically aimed at those with visual impairments. The project will encourage participants to get involved in more creative activities and try to combat social exclusion that can be felt by blind or partially sighted people.

results.title: Promotion Equipment
results.description: This association promotes access to the countryside and birdwatching for disabled people. It will buy a portable exhibition stand to display literature at the British Bird Fair and encourage more people to join the organisation.

results.title: New Equipment
results.description: Children from the local pre-school and primary school will have the chance to try tennis for the first time and attend training sessions run by qualified coaches.

results.title: New Equipment
results.description: This cricket club will develop the skills of its younger members through the provision of new training equipment.

results.title: Increase Membership
results.description: This group promotes the sport of tennis. The award means they can advertise their club in order to attract new members. They will also be able to set up 'mini tots tennis' sessions to encourage participation in the sport from an early age and set up an 'equipment pool' to allow any new members to try the sport before having to purchase the associated equipment. publicity costs, costs of 'mini-tots tennis' (venue hire and equipment), equipment.

results.title: After School Sports Club and Coaching
results.description: A new out of hours sports club will be set up to introduce children and their parents to a range of multi sports including, fitness training, athletics, kwik cricket, tag and junior rugby, basketball, football, netball, baseball and tennis.

recipientOrganization.name: St Thomas Aquinas Catholic Combined School

results.title: Equipment for disabled people
results.description: This club will buy equipment to enable it to start up.  Disabled people from Shepway will be able to take part in cycling.  They will be provided with an activity to improve health and the recreational activities available.  Guided rides will be available and the club will link with physiotherapists to provide support on equipment and duration of riding.

results.title: Woodcraft Curriculum Development
results.description: A consultant will be employed to develop a curriculum for all ages of Woodcraft Folk.  It will include knowledge of fire building, shelter construction, crafting wood, camp fires, flora and fauna identification, knots and health and safety.  A dedicated website will be launched in conjunction with this curriculum, enabling all youth leaders free access to the material.  Basic equipment will be provided so all activities to be on the curriculum can take place.

beneficiaryLocation.name: The City of Brighton and Hove

results.title: New Equipment
results.description: This club will offer more people the chance to take up trampolining through the provision of new equipment.

grantProgramme._id: Big Local Trust: Getting people involved
New Opportunities for PE and Sport
YPF and Reaching Out - Grants to Orgs
